abstract_summ: CONCLUSIONS: Veterans undergoing laparoscopic paraesophageal hernia repair experience similar outcomes as patients in the private sector.CONCLUSION: Elderly patients undergoing CAWR with biological mesh have comparable outcomes with non-elderly patients when using propensity matching score.However, the recurrence rate and duration of oxygen supplementation at 30 days are higher than CDH patients with a true defect.The ratio of open versus laparoscopic paraesophageal hernia repairs varied significantly by different Veterans Integrated Services Network regions.Fifty four patients (31 males, 23 females) underwent VSD repair from November 2016 to November 2018 via anterolateral thoracotomy with age ranges from 3 to 22 years (mean age 10.57 + 8.88 years).
title_summ: Congenital diaphragmatic eventration and hernia sac compared to CDH with true defects: a retrospective cohort studyComplex abdominal wall hernia repair with biologic mesh in elderly: a propensity matched analysisRepair of ventricular septal defect through anterolateral thoracotomy with central cannulation: our experienceOutcomes of Paraesophageal Hernia Repair: Analysis of the Veterans Affairs Surgical Quality Improvement Program Database
title_abstract_phrases: CONCLUSIONS: Veterans undergoing laparoscopic paraesophageal hernia repair experience similar outcomes as patients in the private sector.CONCLUSION: Elderly patients undergoing CAWR with biological mesh have comparable outcomes with non-elderly patients when using propensity matching score.However, the recurrence rate and duration of oxygen supplementation at 30 days are higher than CDH patients with a true defect.Outcomes of Paraesophageal Hernia Repair: Analysis of the Veterans Affairs Surgical Quality Improvement Program DatabaseBACKGROUND: While there have been many outcome studies on paraesophageal hernia repair in the civilian population, there is sparse recent data on the veteran population.The ratio of open versus laparoscopic paraesophageal hernia repairs varied significantly by different Veterans Integrated Services Network regions.
